creditline: Gift of Mary and Bob Mersky
description: Abstract wall sculpture; white cloth with black ink spots and lines; multicolored painted canvas and paper strips nailed to a steel armature; some thin steel wires
medium: Acrylic, cloth, paper, wire, and pigments on canvas, wood, and steel
text:
Iva Gueorguieva was born in Sofia, Bulgaria in 1974. In 1990, after the fall of Bulgarian communist regime, her family immigrated to the United States. Blurring the boundaries between painting and sculpture, Gueorguieva’s painterly compositions juxtapose the hardness of bent steel and the poetics of gestural lines, shapes, and vibrant colors.

The energy of her bold palette with chaotic and exuberant compositions suggests shifting moods of anxiety and emotion. Despite the absence of any obvious narratives, her unique style of abstraction evokes tales of beauty and violence.
title: Talisman Debris
